headline: Tesla jumps as SpaceX merger talks fuel Musk empire consolidation hopes
summary: Shares of Tesla jumped more than 5% on Friday, after reports that SpaceX was in deal talks with Elon Musk's other ​companies stoked investor hopes that the billionaire's tech empire could be unified ‌further.  SpaceX is in discussions to merge with Musk's AI startup, xAI, ahead of a blockbuster public offering ‌planned for this year, Reuters reported on Thursday.  Separately, Bloomberg also reported that SpaceX is considering a merger with Tesla.

Separately, Bloomberg also reported that SpaceX is considering a merger with Tesla.

headline: SpaceX in merger talks with other Musk companies ahead of IPO
summary: STORY: SpaceX is exploring deals with other companies helmed by Elon Musk.The rocket maker is in discussions to merge with artificial intelligence company xAI ahead of a blockbuster public offering planned for this year.The combination would bring Musk’s rockets, Starlink satellites, social media platform X and Grok chatbot under one roof.That's according to a person briefed on the matter and two regulatory filings.SpaceX is also considering a merger with Musk's electric vehicle maker Tesla, according to Bloomberg.The world's richest man is CEO of SpaceX and xAI, which controls X.He also runs Tesla, tunnel firm The Boring Company, and neurotechnology outfit Neuralink.Neither Musk nor any of the firms responded to requests for comment.Shares in Tesla rose 3% in after-hours trade Thursday.Some of its shareholders have long advocated bringing Musk's companies together.Stock Trader Network chief market strategist Dennis Dick says a major risk thesis for Tesla is that "Musk is spreading himself out too much." For SpaceX, a massive deal could complicate its IPO plans.But it might add momentum to efforts to launch data centers into orbit, a key goal for Musk in the escalating AI race. xAI shares would be exchanged for SpaceX shares if the two merged. A Reuters source says no final agreement has been signed and the deal timing and structure remain fluid.

raw.headline: SpaceX in merger talks with other Musk companies ahead of IPO
raw.summary: STORY: SpaceX is exploring deals with other companies helmed by Elon Musk.The rocket maker is in discussions to merge with artificial intelligence company xAI ahead of a blockbuster public offering planned for this year.The combination would bring Musk’s rockets, Starlink satellites, social media platform X and Grok chatbot under one roof.That's according to a person briefed on the matter and two regulatory filings.SpaceX is also considering a merger with Musk's electric vehicle maker Tesla, according to Bloomberg.The world's richest man is CEO of SpaceX and xAI, which controls X.He also runs Tesla, tunnel firm The Boring Company, and neurotechnology outfit Neuralink.Neither Musk nor any of the firms responded to requests for comment.Shares in Tesla rose 3% in after-hours trade Thursday.Some of its shareholders have long advocated bringing Musk's companies together.Stock Trader Network chief market strategist Dennis Dick says a major risk thesis for Tesla is that "Musk is spreading himself out too much." For SpaceX, a massive deal could complicate its IPO plans.But it might add momentum to efforts to launch data centers into orbit, a key goal for Musk in the escalating AI race. xAI shares would be exchanged for SpaceX shares if the two merged. A Reuters source says no final agreement has been signed and the deal timing and structure remain fluid.

headline: Tesla Reorients From Premium EVs To Optimus Robots And xAI Future
summary: Tesla is shifting away from Model S and Model X production to focus on mass manufacturing its Optimus humanoid robots, repurposing its California factory for this new line. The company is expanding its autonomous technology efforts and committing $2b to Elon Musk's AI startup xAI. Rumors are circulating about a potential merger between Tesla and either SpaceX or xAI, which could reshape the group structure around AI, robotics, and autonomy. headline: Elon Musk Says Tesla Model S, X Production To End, Cybertruck To Transition To An Autonomous Vehicle With Fleet Future: 'It's Time To Bring…'
summary: Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) will stop producing the Model S, as well as the Model X, CEO Elon Musk confirmed during the company's fourth-quarter earnings call. Tesla Ends Model S, Model X Production During Tesla's Q4 earnings call on Wednesday, Musk relayed the news to investors and analysts that the automaker would be scrapping its two premium offerings.
